While the Kingdomâ€™s mainland possessions were conquered and annexed by France during the Napoleonic Wars, the island of Sardinia remained independent ensuring continuity of government. Probably the most direct and important ancestor of the Kingdom of Italy, under the leadership of Count Camillo Cavour. Was the primary belligerent in alliance with France against Austria in the three Italian Wars of Independence, fought over Lombardy-Venetia. Nice and Savoy were transferred to the French in March 1860 in exchange for support in creating a united Italy. Shortly after this transfer was completed, Sardinia absorbed the United Provinces of Central Italy. This merged entity became the Kingdom of Italy in a merger with the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies in March 1861.
